title: SoundBot SB571 Review | AMAZING SOUND QUALITY!

json.text: Hey guys this is AppsOnFire and this is probably one of my favorite bluetooth speakers so far.
I have reviewed many bluetooth speakers but the sound quality on this one is just amazing
and its also pretty cheap as well. Stay tuned. So design wise this immediately reminded me
of a jawbone jambox. They are not exactly alike but are very similar. The front of the
speaker has that similar staggered diamond design on the front which is like the jambox.
Also the same kind of build as well. The whole speaker is made up of this soft touch polycarbonate
like material that feels really nice and doesn't attract a lot of fingerprints which is a big
plus. The material also seems pretty durable and really adds to the build quality. Going
back to front you get this metal grill which also looks nice but when I push on it there
is a little give and does creak a bit. But its not that big of a problem though. On the
top you get these circle buttons. You get a button for answering calls because it does
have a built in microphone just in case someone is calling when your listening to music. You
also get your play/pause, forward and backward skip buttons, and your volume buttons. You
guys know I love it when bluetooth speakers have seperate buttons for the volume and skip
buttons. So soundbot nailed it with the layout. While the buttons are pretty responsive, I
really wish that they were more tactile because sometimes I feel like I don't know whether
I was pressing the buttons or not. So pairing the speaker was super easy as expected. It
connects to my device really fast and I had no problems with stuttering when playing music.
You also get a little voice notification when you are connected and beeps when you reach
the maximum volume level. Little touches like this make the speaker a lot more premium.
Also Iwas pretty impressed with the range as well. Soundbot claims it to be 33 feet
and it seems to be accurate when you are in open space and there are no walls blocking.
Battery life on this speaker was good. You have a 1000mAh battery in this speaker and
should get you about 8 hours music playback when on bluetooth and 12 hours using an aux
cable. So overall the battery life was pretty average and really nothing to complain about.
Know for the best thing that this speaker offers. The sound quality. The soundbot sb571
is a total beast at sound quality. Soundbot was really pushing that this speaker had great
sound quality so I was expecting a lot out of this speaker. It is supposed to have dynamic
bass, crispy mids, and crystal clear highs. That was what soundbot advertised on the box
and that is what you get. Soundbot really did a great job with this speaker sound quality
wise. You get a really nice full and rich sound and everything is super clear and the
vocals really stand out. The bass is also pretty good on this speaker and that is very
rare for bluetooth speakers with this price point. So if you are looking for great sound
quality at a low price than the soundbot sb571 is the way to go. It may not be able to compete
with the really high end speakers but it is still very very good. So at the time of this
video it goes for about 25 dollars on amazon and that completely blows my mind so I suggest
you go get this now. It would make a really good christmas gift. It has some really good
reviews on amazon and everyone who reviewed gave it a five star rating so I'm not the
only one who thinks this is a great bluetooth speaker. It is absolutely worth the price
and I totally recommend it. Thats basically it for this review. Make sure to leave a like
to show your support and follow me on instagram and twitter so we can stay connected, my usernames
are at the end of the video. Thanks for watching and I'll see you in the next review.
